oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Introduction to Cloning
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tiemeier, David C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: DNA cloning
DNA technology
gene expression
amplification
selection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cloning is a generic term that means to select an individual from a population and make many copies of that individual. In the cell culture laboratory, cloning has been applied to a series of procedures that allow the scientist to select a particular cell type from a mixed population of cells and propagate that one cell type for more detailed analysis. In recent science fiction, cloning has been applied to the copying of particular human beings. DNA cloning is neither of these and it involves a unique set of procedures that permit the selection and amplification of specific pieces of DNA.
